column2: ND DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
2. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column6: slow down or move over safely.

column2: 3. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 4. Drivers who are 21 years of age or older considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
5. This road sign is:
6. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a low place in the road.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 7. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 8. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
9. What does a red arrow on a traffic light mean?
column4: You must stop. Do not go in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column6: You may proceed slowly through the intersection.
column8: You may turn in the direction of the arrow.
column10: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.

column2: 10. When you are driving, turning your head and looking before changing lanes is:
column8: unnecessary, you should use your rearview mirror instead.

column2: 11. Warning signs normally are:
12. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column10: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
14. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column6: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow

column2: 16. A red traffic signal light means that you must:
column4: when there is no stop line, stop before entering any crosswalk.
column8: where there is no stop line or crosswalk, stop before entering the intersection.

column2: 17. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may stop to let out passengers.
column6: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column8: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column10: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.

column2: 18. Your BAC depends on:
column6: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 19. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.
column10: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.

column2: 20. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column8: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.
column10: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.

column2: 21. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column6: others drive below the speed limit.
column8: anything makes conditions less than perfect.
column10: you are on a four lane road.

column2: 22. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
23. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column10: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 24. Many crashes are caused by:
column6: frequently checking mirrors and blind spot.
column10: maintaining a 4-second following distance between your vehicle and any vehicle in front of you.

column2: 25. This sign indicates:
column4: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.
column8: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.
column10: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
